com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu

Class AbstractLocalizedCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu.AbstractLocalizedCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNotifingLocalizedCommand, CheckInlineCommand, CheckWithCorrectionDialogCommand, SetMenuPositonCommand, ShowOptionsCommand

    public abstract class AbstractLocalizedCommand
extends Object
    The class AbstractLocalizedCommand is a localized version of a Command. You don't have to care about translation. You only have to return the correct Identifier.

        public List<Command> getCommands()

      • isBold

        public boolean isBold()
        Specified by:
        isBold in interface Command
        Returns:
        false. If you want to display the text in bold you have to override this method. Note: It's not possible to display text in bold in all GUI frameworks. It is possible that this property won't have any effect.

      • isIndented

        public boolean isIndented()
        Specified by:
        isIndented in interface Command
        Returns:
        false; override this method if you want to indent the command in a menu

      • getTextColor

        public MarkingColor getTextColor()
        Specified by:
        getTextColor in interface Command
        Returns:
        null; override this method if you want to return another text color than the default one

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Command
        Returns:
        true; override this method if you want to disable the command

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        Specified by:
        isChecked in interface Command
        Returns:
        false; override this method if you want the command to be checkable. You could use a ToggleCommand.
